news_text: The U.S. Marshals Service has disclosed that the government holds 28,988 BTC, valued at $3.4 billion, significantly less than the previously estimated 200,000 BTC. The information was revealed following a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request.

Ethereum reached a multi-month price high of $3,400, boosting its market capitalization to $400 billion and placing it as the 26th largest global asset. The price increase is linked to a record daily inflow of $726.6 million into U.S. spot Ethereum ETFs on July 16.
BlackRock has filed an application to add staking services to its spot Ethereum ETF.
American company Bit Origin is raising up to $500 million to purchase Dogecoin, aiming to become the first U.S.-listed company to adopt DOGE as a core treasury asset.
The government of India has invested in QpiAI, a startup that specializes in integrating quantum computing and artificial intelligence.
In France, a bill has been introduced proposing a five-year pilot project to utilize surplus energy from nuclear power plants for Bitcoin mining.
An early Bitcoin whale, who held over 80,000 BTC, has moved 40,192 BTC (worth approximately $4.77 billion) to a new wallet, sparking speculation about a potential sale.
Sberbank plans to begin offering services for the storage of crypto-assets.
A new anti-money laundering authority, AMLA, has begun operations in the European Union, introducing strict new rules for all crypto companies starting this month.
Analysts estimate that in 2024, Russian miners have mined approximately 40,000 BTC, valued at over $4.5 billion at the current exchange rate.
OpenAI is preparing to enable purchases directly within ChatGPT and is testing an in-chat ordering feature with partners, including Shopify.
Authorities in Thailand plan to launch a nationwide "crypto-sandbox" to allow tourists to freely use cryptocurrency for payments throughout the country.
South Korea's largest crypto exchange, Upbit, could face a record fine of up to $131 billion for over 9.5 million violations of KYC regulations.
The number of USDT users has grown 160-fold since 2020, from 2.8 million to 450 million people.
Coinbase has launched Base App, a "super-app" that integrates social networking and payment features.
Veteran trader Peter Brandt has stated that the altseason has begun.
Roger Ver has filed a lawsuit with the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR) to fight his extradition to the United States.
ZK-project Privacy Pools has integrated the USDS stablecoin from Sky.
Google Search has added an AI-powered feature for making calls to businesses.
Participants in the PUMP presale have sold nearly 60% of their tokens.
BitMine has surpassed SharpLink in its reserves of Ethereum.
A recent study indicates that Gen Z primarily spends cryptocurrency on games, while millennials use it for real estate investments.
A bill has been introduced in the U.S. Congress that would require lenders to consider cryptocurrency holdings during the mortgage credit evaluation process.
The SEC has further delayed its decision on Bitwise’s proposal to allow in-kind redemptions for its Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs.
The market capitalization of XRP has surpassed $185 billion for the first time.
An Ethereum ICO whale who initially invested $416 has realized gains of $4.9 million, having recently deposited 729 ETH ($2.53 million) to Kraken while still holding $2.07 million in staked assets.
Matador Technologies has unveiled a $656 million plan to acquire 6,000 BTC by 2027, with the goal of becoming one of the top 20 corporate holders.
Three crypto-related bills—the CLARITY Act, the GENIUS Act, and the Anti-CBDC Act—have all passed in the U.S. House of Representatives.

Following the passage of landmark stablecoin legislation in the House, former SEC Commissioner Paul Atkins stated that the SEC is considering an "innovation exception" from regulations to promote tokenization.
